/**  @brief      Set the state and luminosity of a simple indicator.
  *  @param[in]  handle Handle to the indicator.
  *  @param[in]  state The state to set.
  *  @param[in]  luminosity Luminosity value, in the range 0 to 100.
  *  @retval     returns #PDM_FP_STATUS_OK if successful, otherwise an error
  *              status.
  *
  *  This can be used to set the basic states of all supported indicators, with
  *  the #PDM_FD_ALL_INDICATORS handle.
  *
  *  Pattern inidciators should use #PDM_FP_StartPattern.
  */
SYSTEM_STATUS PDM_FP_SetState(PDM_FP_HANDLE handle, PDM_FP_STATE state, uint32_t luminosity);

/**
 * @link SIM_DEVICEMAN_RegisterListenerMso SIM_DEVICEMAN_RegisterListenerMso @endlink
 */
SYSTEM_STATUS SIM_DEVICEMAN_RegisterListenerMso(SIM_MSO_LISTENER listener)
{
    SYSTEM_STATUS status = SIM_DEVICEMAN_STATUS_OK;

    SIM_TB_LOG_FN_ENTRY("SIM_DEVICEMAN_RegisterListenerMso()");

    /* Only one listener is supported currently. That is probably all that is
       needed as only MCM registers for MSO's */
    SIM_LISTENER_LOCK();
    f_mso_listener = listener;
    SIM_LISTENER_UNLOCK();

    SIM_TB_LOG_FN_EXITX(status);
    return status;
}

/**
 * @brief Creates an SCI MSO object from a PMT and returns it to the Framework.
 *
 * Creates an SCI Media Status Object and returns it to the Framework.
 * The Framework will pass it onto any registered MSO listener.
 *
 * @param[in] p_mc_context    Pointer to the context stored in the MC linked list.
 * @param[in] p_section_data  Pointer to the PMT section (NULL if sci_service_status
 *                            is anything other than SYSTEMOBJECT_SCI_PROPID_I_SERVICE_STATUS).
 */
static void SIM_engine_xsi_mc_CreateSciMso(SIM_PI_MCLIST_MC_CONTEXT       *p_mc_context,
                                           const uint8_t                  *p_section_data)
{
    SIM_STATUS           sim_status          = SIM_STATUS_FAILED;
    SYSTEMOBJECT_HANDLE  systemobject_h      = SYSTEMOBJECT_HANDLE_INVALID;
    uint32_t             service_status      = 0u;
    SYSTEM_STATUS        mso_status          = SYSTEMOBJECT_STATUS_NOT_OK;
    SIM_EXT_SERVICE_INFO ext_info;
    SIM_PSI_PMT_CA_DESCRIPTOR_CB_CONTEXT ca_callback_context;

    ca_callback_context.ca_callback = SIM_engine_xsi_mc_CADescriptorCallback;
    ca_callback_context.p_user_data = p_mc_context;

    if (service_status != 0u)
    {
        SIM_PROFILE_STR_ZAPTIME(("%u SIM_PROFILE:SIM_engine_xsi_mc_CreateSciMso "SIM_MC_STRING"  About to make SCI object\n",
                                SIM_PROFILE_GetTimestamp(),
                                p_mc_context->h_mc));

        ext_info.streaming_policy = g_sim_mso_config.default_streaming_policy;
        ext_info.pmt_tpid         = p_mc_context->pmt_tpid;

        if ((sim_status = SIM_PSI_ParsePmtSection(p_section_data,
                                                  NULL,
                                                  &ca_callback_context,
                                                  0u,
                                                  g_sim_pi_xsi_config.pdi_pmt,
                                                  service_status,
                                                  SIM_MSO_CreateSCI,
                                                  g_sim_pi_xsi_config.process_all_dvb_descriptors,
                                                  &ext_info,
                                                  &systemobject_h)) != SIM_STATUS_OK)
        {
        }
        else
        {
            mso_status = SYSTEMOBJECT_STATUS_OK;
            DIAG_PMON_PMT_ACQUIRED(SIM_TB_DIAG_ID, p_mc_context->h_mc, "OK");
        }

        /*Signal finished parsing PMT*/
        ca_callback_context.ca_callback(ca_callback_context.p_user_data, NULL);
    }

    /* Call the mso listener, from where any listeners will be called */
    SIM_MSO_Listener(p_mc_context->h_mc,
                     SYSTEMOBJECT_TYPE_SCI,
                     mso_status,
                     systemobject_h);
}

        {
            if (false == l_keep_boot_entries)
            {
                memset(conf->DNSAddresses,
                        0,
                        sizeof(conf->DNSAddresses));
                NCM_COMMON_BITFIELD_UNSET_BIT(conf->StateFlags, NCM_SERVER_DNS_STATIC);
                NCM_LOG_INFO(("All DNS servers will be deleted."));

            else
            {
                NCM_LOG_INFO(("All DNS servers are kept."));
            }
            l_status = NCM_STATUS_OK;

        else

            NCM_LOG_INFO(("All DNS servers are kept."));

976:NDS: ^[2018:09:04 12:32:01]0946684943.497138 !INFO   -NCM_SERVER   		< p:0x00000386 P:SCD t:0x0074f530 T:NCM_SERVER_APPLY M:ncm_server_xnet_dns.c F:ncm_server_xnet_dns_set_servers L:55 > Set 0 DNS servers. 

SYSTEM_STATUS ncm_server_xnet_dns_set_servers(
        const struct sockaddr_storage * dnsAddresses,
        uint8_t                         numAddresses)
{
    SYSTEM_STATUS   l_status = NCM_STATUS_OK;
    int32_t         l_ret = 0;
    uint32_t        l_i;

    NCM_LOG_FN_ENTRY("ncm_server_xnet_dns_set_servers");
    NCM_COMMON_ASSERT( ((numAddresses == 0) || (NULL != dnsAddresses)) );


    NCM_LOG_INFO(("Set %u DNS servers%c", numAddresses, (numAddresses == 0U ? '.' : ':')));
    for (l_i = 0U; l_i < numAddresses; l_i++) {
        NCM_COMMON_DISPLAY_SOCKADDR_STORAGE(&dnsAddresses[l_i], 0U, INFO);
    }

    l_ret = xnet_dns_set_servers(
            dnsAddresses,
            numAddresses);
    if (l_ret != 0)
    {
        NCM_COMMON_PRINT_ERRNO();
        NCM_LOG_ERROR(("Failed to set DNS servers."));

        l_status = NCM_STATUS_FAILURE;
    }

    NCM_LOG_FN_EXIT(l_status);
    return l_status;
}

From OS time perspective, 19:41:26 - 19:00:00 = 2486 seconds have elapsed, as requested by VGV.
From SYSTEMTIME perspective 23:03:59 - 22:12:02 = 3117 seconds have elapsed, taking us out of the window.

[si_logs@theyard darwin_783e532f8c64_b53ece6586e4b30d55d615ef503f824a]$ egrep -an "RTC_SET_CLOCK" KMSG.LOG
202:<4>[0946685014.232040]ERROR ioctl_RTC_SET_CLOCK:363 SET UTC - 263476l, RTC - 58384l

593026:NDS: ^[2018:09:24 00:27:51]0946758351.004512 !MIL    -SYSTEMTIME   		< p:0x00000218 P:MW t:0x01c2f520 T:SIM_PLUGIN_XSI_MC_ENGINE_THREAD M:systemtime.c F:SYSTEMTIME_SetTime L:1058 
> Time has been updated to (Year:Month:Day:Hour:Min:Sec) 2018:09:24:05:02:29 
593057:NDS: ^[2018:09:24 00:28:06]`0946758366`.039810 !MIL    -BEM          		< p:0x00000218 P:MW t:0x01948520 T:BEM_INTERNAL_EVENT_THREAD M:bem_internal_event.c F:BEM_InternalEvent_CheckHdcpStatus L:2787 > HDMI_HDCP_GET_BSTATUS failed, errno 145 
593059:NDS: ^[2018:09:24 00:28:07]0946758367.000191 !MIL    -SYSTEMTIME   		< p:0x00000218 P:MW t:0x01c2f520 T:SIM_PLUGIN_XSI_MC_ENGINE_THREAD M:systemtime.c F:SYSTEMTIME_SetTime L:1058 
> Time has been updated to (Year:Month:Day:Hour:Min:Sec) 2018:09:24:05:02:50 

At bootup VGV sets a timer to wake up at the start of the window (19:00). There is no MIL print for when that timer is set.

In the following line, the start of window timer has fired. You can see that print has OS timestamp of 19:00:00. But when VGV reads current time from SYSTEMTIME it gets 79922 seconds after midnight or 22:12:02. In other words, VGV had set a timer to wake up at 19:00 but was woken up at 22:12 instead.
Next VGV schedules the callback to some random time inside the window. 
Since window ends at 23:00, VGV sees it has 82800-79922 = 2878 seconds until end of window. It sets a timer for a random interval  2486 - which should be at 79922 + 2486 = 82408 = 22:53:28.

== 475503:NDS: ^[2018:09:23 19:00:00]0946738680.611910 !MIL    -VGC                              < p:0x00000218 P:MW t:0x01b2fe80 T:no name M:../../../../OS_Port/posix_merge/p_fusion_ext.c F:SSF L:162 > NDS.SSF ssf_set_forward_timer called at mjd 58384, sec 79922, timer for <2486> seconds requested

However, callback timer is triggered here:
== 500020:NDS: ^[2018:09:23 19:41:24]0946741164.937161 !MIL    -SYSTEMTIME                             < p:0x00000218 P:MW t:0x018d7520 T:SYSTEMTIME_NOTIFICATION_THREAD M:systemtime_thread.c F:SYSTEMTIME_TimeStampCallback L:153 > Time is (Year:Month:Day:Hour:Min:Sec) 2018:09:23:23:03:59 
== 500045:NDS: ^[2018:09:23 19:41:26]0946741166.782681 !ERROR  -VGC                                          < p:0x00000218 P:MW t:0x01b2fe80 T:no name M:../../../../OS_Port/posix_merge/p_fusion_ext.c F:SSF L:168 > NDS.SSF ssf_compare_forward_files failed, current date is after forward window is closed

From OS time perspective, 19:41:26 - 19:00:00 = 2486 seconds have elapsed, as requested by VGV.
From SYSTEMTIME perspective 23:03:59 - 22:12:02 = 3117 seconds have elapsed, taking us out of the window.
In other words, VGV had set a timer to wake up at 22:53 but was woken up at 23:03 instead.

|kt_si_log_0001| SI-11534: VESPA


"2018:09:06 18:43:30" is before the forwarding window, so a callback would only occur if there was <1K of the 10K SSF storage left, triggering an immediate callback.
The 12307 includes SSF metadata and the names of the files + hash of the file, so is probably below this threshold.

static SYSTEM_STATUS PLAYER_PRV_Session_PlayTrailer(PLAYER_PLAY_PARAMETERS *l_param_struct,
                                                    PLAYER_JOB_DATA *new_job);

        if (g_player_component.use_planner_rating_for_playback == true)
        {
            /* Get the event rating */
            if ((PLAYER_API_STATUS_OK == l_status) && (PLAYER_RECORDING_BASE_MANUAL != new_job->recording_base))
            {
                l_status = PLAYER_PRV_Session_Get_Event_Rating_From_Planner(new_job, l_bookedprogramme);
            }
        }
        else
        {
            PLAYER_DIAG_LOG_INFO(("g_player_component.use_planner_rating_for_playback = false"));
        }

// added to R16
$ git log -S PLAYER_PRV_Session_Get_Event_Rating_From_Planner -- DARWIN_PLATFORM/DARWIN_PLAYER/src/player_api_session.c

commit e157f3e3f99787ee6a6637cd00bc7f451204b0b4
Author: Marcin Wojtczak <mawojtcz@cisco.com>
Date:   Fri Nov 25 14:53:06 2016 +0000

    [F2172] US15943 Player change to use PIN rating from SEI  (SKIT and Ethan UK)

    details:
    - removed parental control code from PLAYER_SM_VRM_NewEIT
    - moved parental control code from PLAYER_SM_VRM_ProcessSEI into a new function
    - renamed PLAYER_PRV_Session_Get_Event_Rating to have a more meaningful name
    - removed code for cases where source of parental rating is other than SEI
    - removed g_player_component.use_new_eit_for_playback_parental_control
    - removed g_player_component.is_unaligned_schedule_eit_event_information
    - removed g_player_component.broadcaster_carrier_network_id
    - changed PLAYER_Guide_GetCurrentEventInfo - it no longer gets rating from GUIDE

    Change-Id: Ic200e489efd29f4850af80aa6232d8bcccf3e75b

== 17804:NDS: ^[2018:06:16 10:48:57]0946685835.816680 !WARN   -DLM_SVR      		< p:0x000001fd P:MW t:0x020c3520 T:DLM_HANDLEEVENTS M:dlm_mqp_server.c F:DLM_SVR_R2D_ProcessBooking L:2578 > Queue is paused. Ignoring request.... 


static SYSTEM_STATUS DLM_SVR_R2D_ProcessBooking(DLM_SVR_JOB* const p_job, const DLM_SVR_Booking_Info_Prop* const p_payload)
    /* ignore operation if the queue is paused (fix from MID-5437) */
    if (DLM_SVR_QSM_isQueuePaused())
    {
        DLM_SVR_DBG_WARN(("Queue is paused. Ignoring request...."));
        ret = DLM_API_STATUS_OK;
    }

bool DLM_SVR_QSM_isQueuePaused(void)
{
    bool ret = (f_queue_mechanism.system_paused || f_queue_mechanism.user_paused || f_queue_mechanism.retryable_paused);
#ifdef DEBUG
    DLM_SVR_DisplayAllCond();
#endif
    return ret;
}

void DLM_SVR_QSM_DisplayQueueState(void)
{
    DIAG_DECLARE_FUNCTION(("DLM_SVR_QSM_DisplayQueueState"));
    DLM_SVR_DBG_INFO(("-- Queue paused states (RETRY=%d | USER=%d | SYSTEM=%d)",
            f_queue_mechanism.retryable_paused, f_queue_mechanism.user_paused, f_queue_mechanism.system_paused));
}


// NETSET 0 -> DLM_SVR_Net_isNetworkConnected()

void DLM_SVR_DisplayAllCond(void)
{
    DIAG_DECLARE_FUNCTION(("DLM_SVR_DisplayAllCond"));

    DLM_SVR_DBG_INFO(("STB conditions : CARD %d - DISK %d - SERVICE GATE %d - BROADBAND %d - CABLE PLUGGED %d - NETSET %d - CTM_READY %d - SYSTEMTIME %d - NETCHANGED %d",
            g_dlm_card_ready, g_dlm_no_disk_conflict, g_dlm_service_gate_on, g_dlm_bb_on, (DLM_SVR_Net_isWirePlugged()), 
            (DLM_SVR_Net_isNetworkConnected()) , g_dlm_ctm_is_ready, g_dlm_systemtime_ready, (DLM_SVR_Net_isNetChangeDetected()) ));

    DLM_SVR_QSM_DisplayQueueState();
}

bool DLM_SVR_Net_isNetworkConnected(void)
{
    bool ret = false;

    if (DLM_SVR_Net_Get_IPFamilyMask() != (uint32_t)DLM_API_NETWORK_IP_NONE)
    {
        ret = true;
    }

    return ret;
}

uint32_t DLM_SVR_Net_Get_IPFamilyMask(void)
{
    uint32_t i = 0U;
    uint32_t mask = DLM_API_NETWORK_IP_NONE;

    for (i = 0U; i < (sizeof(g_dlm_srv_interfaces)/sizeof(g_dlm_srv_interfaces[0])); i++)
    {
        if ((g_dlm_srv_interfaces[i].family == DLM_API_NETWORK_IP_V4)
            || (g_dlm_srv_interfaces[i].family == DLM_API_NETWORK_IP_V6) )
        {
            mask |= (g_dlm_srv_interfaces[i].state == DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_SET)? g_dlm_srv_interfaces[i].family : 0U ;
        }
    }

    return mask;
}

void DLM_SVR_Net_Handle_Interfaces(uint32_t family, DLM_API_EVENT_TYPE action )
{
    uint32_t i = 0U;

    DLM_SVR_DBG_FN_ENTRY(("DLM_SVR_Net_Handle_Interfaces"));
    DLM_SVR_DBG_INFO(("evt handler: family=0x%08X action=0x%08X ", family, action));

    for (i = 0U; i < (sizeof(g_dlm_srv_interfaces)/sizeof(g_dlm_srv_interfaces[0])); i++)
    {
        DLM_SVR_DBG_INFO(("found family = %d ",g_dlm_srv_interfaces[i].family));
        if (g_dlm_srv_interfaces[i].family == family )
        {
            break;
        }
    }

    if (i < (sizeof(g_dlm_srv_interfaces)/sizeof(g_dlm_srv_interfaces[0])))
    {
        if((action == DLM_API_EVENT_ETHERNET_CABLE_UNPLUGGED)  || (action == DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_UNSET) )
        {
            (void)g_dlm_srv_interfaces[i].down(i, action);
        }
        else if((action == DLM_API_EVENT_ETHERNET_CABLE_PLUGGED)  || (action == DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_SET) )
        {
            (void)g_dlm_srv_interfaces[i].up(i, action);
        }
        else
        {
            /* Required by static analysis tool */
        }
    }

    DLM_SVR_DBG_FN_EXIT(0);
}

// shows actual event, translate it to family and action. event and action uses
// the same enum.

typedef enum
{
   DLM_API_INVALID_EVENT_UNDEF = 0U,
   DLM_API_EVENT_ETHERNET_CABLE_PLUGGED = 1U, /*!< @brief The ethernet network is plugged */
   DLM_API_EVENT_ETHERNET_CABLE_UNPLUGGED = 2U, /*!< @brief The ethernet network is unplugged */
   DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_SET = 3U, /*!< @brief The WAN ipv4 conf is correctly set */
   DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_UNSET = 4U, /*!< @brief The WAN ipv4 conf is correctly unset */
   DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_V6_SET = 5U, /*!< @brief The WAN ipv6 conf is correctly set */
   DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_V6_UNSET = 6U, /*!< @brief The WAN ipv6 conf is correctly unset */

   DLM_API_EVENT_NEW_CLIENT_REGISTERED = 8U,/*!< @brief New client unregistered */
   DLM_API_EVENT_LAST_VALUE = 9U
} DLM_API_EVENT_TYPE;

// to active state
//
// static SYSTEM_STATUS DLM_SVR_Activate(void)
// static SYSTEM_STATUS DLM_SPM_Init(void)
// 		if (DLM_API_STATUS_OK != DLM_SPM_Register())
//         if (DLM_API_STATUS_OK != DLM_SVR_SPM_Check_NetworkStatus())
//
// DARWIN_PLATFORM/DARWIN_DLM/src/dlm_server/dlm_mqp_server.c
// calls Post_SPM_Event()

static SYSTEM_STATUS DLM_SVR_SPM_Check_NetworkStatus(void)

    if (SPM_API_STATUS_OK != SPM_API_Network_GetMainStatus(&main_status))

    (void)DLM_SVR_Post_SPM_Event(event_ipv4);
    (void)DLM_SVR_Post_SPM_Event(event_ipv6);


//        if (SPM_API_STATUS_OK != SPM_API_Network_RegisterMainListener(DLM_NetworkStatus_Listener_Main, 0U,
//
// note:
// convert SPM_API_Network_MainStatus l_status -> DLM_API_EVENT_TYPE)
//     DLM_API_EVENT_TYPE event_ipv4 = DLM_API_INVALID_EVENT_UNDEF;
//     DLM_API_EVENT_TYPE event_ipv6 = DLM_API_INVALID_EVENT_UNDEF;

typedef enum
{
   DLM_API_INVALID_EVENT_UNDEF = 0U,
   DLM_API_EVENT_ETHERNET_CABLE_PLUGGED = 1U, /*!< @brief The ethernet network is plugged */
   DLM_API_EVENT_ETHERNET_CABLE_UNPLUGGED = 2U, /*!< @brief The ethernet network is unplugged */
   DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_SET = 3U, /*!< @brief The WAN ipv4 conf is correctly set */
   DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_UNSET = 4U, /*!< @brief The WAN ipv4 conf is correctly unset */
   DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_V6_SET = 5U, /*!< @brief The WAN ipv6 conf is correctly set */
   DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_V6_UNSET = 6U, /*!< @brief The WAN ipv6 conf is correctly unset */
   DLM_API_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_FAMILY = 7U, /*!< @brief The ip family mask is correctly set/unset */
   DLM_API_EVENT_NEW_CLIENT_REGISTERED = 8U,/*!< @brief New client unregistered */
   DLM_API_EVENT_LAST_VALUE = 9U
} DLM_API_EVENT_TYPE;

static void DLM_NetworkStatus_Listener_Main(SPM_API_Network_MainStatus l_status, SPM_API_UserTag user_tag)



// DARWIN_PLATFORM/DARWIN_SPM/src/client/spm_client_network.c

/** @brief Call Network Main connection status listeners.
  *.
  * @param[in] main_status - status to send to the listeners.
  *
  * @return void.
  */
static void SPM_CLIENT_Network_CallMainListeners(SPM_API_Network_MainStatus main_status)
{
    uint32_t counter;

    SPM_CLIENT_DIAG_LOG_FN_ENTRY(("SPM_CLIENT_Network_CallMainListeners"));

    (void)SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MutexLock(&f_SPM_Network_StaticData_mutex);

    for (counter = 0U; counter < MAX_MAIN_LISTENERS; counter++)
    {
        f_main_listener[counter].listener(main_status, f_main_listener[counter].user_tag);
    }

    (void)SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MutexUnlock(&f_SPM_Network_StaticData_mutex);

    SPM_CLIENT_DIAG_LOG_FN_EXIT(0U);
}


// DARWIN_PLATFORM/DARWIN_SPM/src/client/spm_client_network.c
//

/**
 @brief Network Main connection possible status.
*/
typedef enum SPM_API_Network_main_status
{
    SPM_API_NETWORK_MAIN_UNDEF,
    SPM_API_NETWORK_MAIN_CONFIG_SET,               /**< IPv4 configuration set, Ipv6 unset */
    SPM_API_NETWORK_MAIN_CONFIG_UNSET,             /**< IPv4 and Ipv6 configuration unset */
    SPM_API_NETWORK_MAIN_CONFIGv6_SET,             /**< IPv6 configuration set, Ipv4 unset */
    SPM_API_NETWORK_MAIN_CONFIGv4v6_SET,           /**< IPv4 and Ipv6 configuration set */
    SPM_API_NETWORK_MAIN_LAST_VALUE
} SPM_API_Network_MainStatus;

means
    SPM_API_NETWORK_MAIN_CONFIG_SET(1)

static void SPM_CLIENT_Network_ProcessAsynchronousExternalMessage(const SPM_CLIENT_GENERIC_MESSAGE* pMessage)

        case SPM_SERVER2CLIENT_EVENT_NETWORK_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_SET:
            `main_status` = pMessage->externalMessage.payload.network_payload.data.main_status;
            SPM_CLIENT_Network_CallMainListeners(main_status);
            break;

        case SPM_SERVER2CLIENT_EVENT_NETWORK_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_UNSET:
            main_status = pMessage->externalMessage.payload.network_payload.data.main_status;
            SPM_CLIENT_Network_CallMainListeners(main_status);
            break;


// DARWIN_PLATFORM/DARWIN_SPM/src/server/network/spm_network.c

static void SPM_NCM_Event(const SPM_NETWORK_MESSAGE *message)

        case NCM_SESSION_EVENT_TYPE_GLOBAL_NET_V6_SET:
        {
            (void)SPM_Network_Handle_GNSV6();

            if (SPM_Network_IsTestInProgress() == false)
            {
                clientEvent = SPM_SERVER2CLIENT_EVENT_NETWORK_EVENT_GLOBAL_NET_SET;
                clientPayload.network_payload.status = SPM_API_STATUS_OK;
                clientPayload.network_payload.data.main_status = `f_main_status`;
            }
        }
        break;


/* Event handler for GLOBAL NET SET V6*/
SPM_HSM_EVENT_IDX SPM_Network_Handle_GNSV6 (void)
{
    SPM_API_Network_MainStatus old_main_status = f_main_status;

    SPM_NETWORK_DIAG_LOG_FN_ENTRY(("SPM_Network_Handle_GNSV6"));

    old_main_status = f_main_status;

    if((f_main_status == SPM_API_NETWORK_MAIN_CONFIG_SET) || (f_main_status == SPM_API_NETWORK_MAIN_CONFIGv4v6_SET))
    {
        f_main_status = SPM_API_NETWORK_MAIN_CONFIGv4v6_SET;
    }
    else
    {
        f_main_status = SPM_API_NETWORK_MAIN_CONFIGv6_SET;
    }

    SPM_NETWORK_DIAG_LOG_INFO(("Received NCM_SESSION_EVENT_TYPE_GLOBAL_NET_V6_SET , f_main_status = %d",f_main_status));
    if (SPM_Network_IsTestInProgress() == true)
    {
        SPM_Network_IPConfigTestWaitForGNS_V6();
    }

    SPM_Network_Notify_ListenersOnMainStatusChange(f_main_status, old_main_status);

    SPM_NETWORK_DIAG_LOG_FN_EXIT(0U);
    return SPM_NETWORK_EVENT_UNDEF;
}

//

// Appreciated Rune for a comment. Thats exactly what I thought and Ill share this for further discussion since I think that we might need consistent behaviour for SD and HD. 
// 
// Many thanks
// Kit Park
// 
// From: Rune Petersen <rune.petersen@craftwork.dk> 
// Sent: 09 May 2018 12:18
// To: Kyoungtaek Park -X (kyoupark - BSKYB at Cisco) <kyoupark@cisco.com>
// Cc: Vinay Acharya -X (vinachar - BSKYB at Cisco) <vinachar@cisco.com>
// Subject: RE: SI-11383: Artefacts doesn't display on My Sky App when OSM is displayed on SD interactive
// 
// Hi Kit,
// 
// This is expected behavior.
// In SD mode the when a popup is displayed, the EPG pauses LAE which redraws the screen without the OSD layer and then the EPG draws the popup.
// This is not the case for the HD mode since image and OSD layer is combined into a single layer.
// 
// If you want to change it so that OSD is also drawn during a popup up it can be done, but since it will cause a visual change it should be discussed by new stake holders.


={============================================================================
|kt_si_log_0001| SI-11378 Automation - AMS XML logs -Video playing reported 'True' when there is pin request on playback

Defect Summary: 

Video playing reported 'True' when there is pin request on playback. It should
be False as the video is not playing. It should only be reported true when
user enters the pin.

the issue:

In the attached images one if from R15 where there is video playing is logged
"false" in XML when pin is requested. Then it is logged again "True" once the
pin is entered.  

But in R16 there is only one XML log which is "true". There is no log when the
pin entry screen is presented.


R000.042.04.00P shows the issue and Defect is not seen in R019.087.67.05P

SI_config.xml

   <!-- SI-10846: Disable Mirroring for only Sky_trails build profile, since SNUG boxes show issue while mirroing using new ETP loader 4.20v-->
   <file name="sdm.cfg">
    <section name="MIRRORING">
     <key name="DISABLE_MIRRORING" type="BOOLEAN" value="TRUE">
     </key>
    </section>
   </file>

https://www.stb.bskyb.com/jira/browse/SI-10846

For Cust_trials build (40.54.00_7215) we see DISABLE_MIRRORING=FALSE,
whereas for Sky_trails build(40.54.00_7214) we see DISABLE_MIRRORING=TRUE

// DARWIN_PLATFORM/DARWIN_SPM/sw_download/src/server/spm_download.c

/**
 * @brief Performs the mirroring of the partitions (if necessary)
 */
static SYSTEM_STATUS SPM_Download_InitPartitions(void)
{
    // !MIL    -SWDL_SVR     		< F:SPM_Download_InitPartitions L:1696 > Partition info for SDM_PARTITION_RT_INACTIVE : sdm_status=0x8c00000, partition_type=2, applicationId=49, producerId=79, version=65535, partition_status=3, irs=6 
    // !MIL    -SWDL_SVR     		< F:SPM_Download_InitPartitions L:1696 > Partition info for SDM_PARTITION_RT_ACTIVE : sdm_status=0x8c00000, partition_type=2, applicationId=49, producerId=79, version=65535, partition_status=3, irs=6 
    // !MIL    -SWDL_SVR     		< F:SPM_Download_InitPartitions L:1696 > Partition info for SDM_PARTITION_BL2_ACTIVE : sdm_status=0x8c20001, partition_type=1, applicationId=0, producerId=0, version=0, partition_status=0, irs=6 
    // !MIL    -SWDL_SVR     		< F:SPM_Download_InitPartitions L:1696 > Partition info for SDM_PARTITION_BL2_INACTIVE : sdm_status=0x8c20006, partition_type=1, applicationId=0, producerId=0, version=0, partition_status=0, irs=6 

    // /* Initiate RT mirroring only if we have successfully acquired information
    //  * about the Active RT partition.
    //  */
    // if((partition_info[SDM_PARTITION_RT_ACTIVE].sdm_status == SDM_API_STATUS_OK) &&
    //    ((partition_info[SDM_PARTITION_RT_INACTIVE].status == SDM_PARTITION_STATUS_CORRUPTED) ||
    //     (partition_info[SDM_PARTITION_RT_ACTIVE].version > partition_info[SDM_PARTITION_RT_INACTIVE].version) ||
    //     (partition_info[SDM_PARTITION_RT_INACTIVE].sdm_status != SDM_API_STATUS_OK)))
    {
        SWDL_SVR_DIAG_LOG_ERROR(("KT: set RT without condition"));
        mirroring_flag |= SDM_MIRRORING_ACTION_RT;
    }

    if(SDM_MIRRORING_ACTION_NONE != mirroring_flag)
    {
        SYSTEMALARM_ALARM_INFO info;

        /* set up a system alarm timer to delay the mirroring */
        info.is_absolute = false;
        info.alarm_data.rel_info.callback = SPM_Download_StartMirroringAlarmListener;
        info.alarm_data.rel_info.is_repeating = false;
        info.alarm_data.rel_info.timeout = (SPM_COMMON_GetConfig()->mirroringDelay) * 1000U; /* mirroring delay may be 0 - systemalarm handles that */
        info.alarm_data.rel_info.user_data = `mirroring_flag`;

        if (SYSTEMALARM_Set(&info, &f_mirroring_delay_alarm) != SYSTEMALARM_STATUS_OK)
        {
            SWDL_SVR_DIAG_LOG_ERROR(("Error in SYSTEMALARM_Set"));
            status = SPM_API_STATUS_ERROR;
        }
        else
        {
            SWDL_SVR_DIAG_LOG_INFO(("Mirroring delayed by %d milliseconds", info.alarm_data.rel_info.timeout));
        }
    }
}


/** @brief Callback function for the alarm. {ASYNC} to start mirroring
*   @brief The callback function should return quickly and should not call any of the alarm API functions.
*   @brief The function is called with the alarm handle and the user data (transferred when setting the alarm)
*/
static void SPM_Download_StartMirroringAlarmListener(SYSTEMALARM_ALARM_HANDLE handle,
                                       usHandle_t user_data_handle)
{
    SPM_DOWNLOAD_INTERNAL_MESSAGE message;

    SWDL_SVR_DIAG_LOG_FN_ENTRY(("SPM_Download_StartMirroringAlarmListener"));

    /* post message */
    message.event = SPM_DOWNLOAD_INTERNAL_EVENT_START_MIRRORING_ALARM_EXPIRED;
    message.payload.start_mirroring_alarm_expired_payload.handle = handle;
    message.payload.start_mirroring_alarm_expired_payload.user_data = `user_data_handle`;

    /* call the callback */
    f_SPM_DOWNLOAD_message_callback((uint8_t*) &message, sizeof(SPM_DOWNLOAD_INTERNAL_MESSAGE));

    SWDL_SVR_DIAG_LOG_FN_EXIT(0U);
    return;
}


{
  case SPM_DOWNLOAD_INTERNAL_EVENT_START_MIRRORING_ALARM_EXPIRED:
    SPM_Download_InternalEventStartMirroringAlarmExpired(messageReceived);
    break;
}


SDM_API_StartMirroring 1622 DARWIN_PLATFORM/DARWIN_SPM/sw_download/src/server/spm_download.c

/**
 * @brief Handler for the SPM_DOWNLOAD_INTERNAL_EVENT_START_MIRRORING_ALARM_EXPIRED message
 * @param[in] messagePtr Message pointer
 */
static void SPM_Download_InternalEventStartMirroringAlarmExpired(const SPM_DOWNLOAD_INTERNAL_MESSAGE* messagePtr)
{
    SWDL_SVR_DIAG_LOG_FN_ENTRY(("SPM_Download_InternalEventStartMirroringAlarmExpired"));

    f_mirroring_delay_alarm = SYSTEMALARM_HANDLE_ILLEGAL;

    if(SPM_DOWNLOAD_TYPE_UNDEF != f_spm_download.downloadType)
    {
        SWDL_SVR_DIAG_LOG_ERROR(("Download in progress. Cannot continue with mirroring."));
    }
    else
    {
        /* start the delayed mirroring */

        // SYSTEM_STATUS SDM_API_StartMirroring(SDM_COMPLETION_CALLBACK mirror_complete_callback,
        // `SDM_MIRRORING_ACTION_FLAG mirror_action`,
        // uint32_t user_tag);
        //
        // #define SDM_MIRRORING_ACTION_NONE  0x00
        // #define SDM_MIRRORING_ACTION_RT    0x01     /* Bit mask to mirror the RunTime partition */
        // #define SDM_MIRRORING_ACTION_BL2   0x02     /* Bit mask to mirror the BL2 partition */
        // !ERROR  -SDM          		< p:0x00000207 P:MW t:0x0205e520 T:SPM_DISPATCHER M:sdm_client.c F:SDM_API_StartMirroring L:1397 > mirror_action not valid [0] 

        if (SDM_API_StartMirroring(SPM_Download_MirrorCallback, messagePtr->payload.start_mirroring_alarm_expired_payload.user_data, 0U) != SDM_API_STATUS_OK)
        {
            SWDL_SVR_DIAG_LOG_ERROR(("SDM_API_StartMirroring failed"));
        }
        else
        {
            SWDL_SVR_DIAG_LOG_MIL(("[SWDL] Partition mirroring started..."));
            f_spm_download.downloadType = SPM_DOWNLOAD_TYPE_MIRRORING;
            f_spm_download.state = SPM_DOWNLOAD_STATE_OPERATION_IN_PROGRESS;
        }
    }

    SWDL_SVR_DIAG_LOG_FN_EXIT(0U);
}

SYSTEM_STATUS SDM_API_StartMirroring(SDM_COMPLETION_CALLBACK mirror_complete_callback,
        SDM_MIRRORING_ACTION_FLAG mirror_action,
        uint32_t user_tag)
{
        message.event = SDM_EVENT_START_MIRRORING;
}

void SDM_StartMirroringThread(const SDM_MESSAGE* messagePtr)
{
    if (disableMirroring == false)
    {
        f_mirror_action = messagePtr->payload.mirroring.mirror_action;
        f_first_pass_error = SDM_MIRRORING_STATUS_OK;

        if (SDM_SpawnMirroringThread() != SDM_API_STATUS_OK)
        {
            SDM_DIAG_LOG_ERROR(("SDM_SpawnMirroringThread failed"));
        }
        else if (SYSTEMITC_API_PostEvent(&f_mirroringQueue,
                    (uint32_t)SDM_MIRRORING_EVENT_START_MIRRORING,
                    messagePtr,
                    sizeof(SDM_MESSAGE)) != SYSTEMITC_OK)
        {
        }
    }
}

static void *SDM_MirroringThread(void* param)
{
                /* process the message */
                switch(event)
                {
                    case SDM_MIRRORING_EVENT_START_MIRRORING:
                        SDM_DIAG_LOG_EVENT(("SDM_MIRRORING_EVENT_START_MIRRORING message received"));
                        image_type = (p_sdm_message->payload.mirroring.image_type);
                        `SDM_StartMirroring`(image_type);
                        break;
}


== !MIL    -SDM          		< T:SDM_MIRRORING_THREAD M:sdm_mirroring.c F:SDM_StartMirroring L:112 > Mirroring start from active (version 0xffff) to inactive (version 0x0) 


/**
 * @brief Performs the main part of mirroring (copying of the image).
 *        Handler for the SDM_MIRRORING_EVENT_CONTINUE_MIRRORING message. This function is usually
 *        called multiple times during one mirroring process
 *
 *        This function is called from the mirroring thread context.
 */
static void SDM_ContinueMirroring(void)
{
    message = (
            (f_mirroringData.error == SDM_MIRRORING_STATUS_OK) &&
            (f_mirroringData.offset < f_mirroringData.endOffset)
            ) /* the same condition as for the while loop */
        ? SDM_MIRRORING_EVENT_CONTINUE_MIRRORING
        : SDM_MIRRORING_EVENT_COMPLETE_IMAGE;

    if (SYSTEMITC_API_PostEvent(&f_mirroringQueue, (uint32_t)message, NULL, 0U) != SYSTEMITC_OK)
}


{
                    case SDM_MIRRORING_EVENT_COMPLETE_IMAGE:
                        SDM_DIAG_LOG_ERROR(("KT: SDM_MIRRORING_EVENT_COMPLETE_IMAGE message received"));
                        SDM_CompleteMirrorImage();
                        break;


                    case SDM_MIRRORING_EVENT_FINISH_MIRRORING:
                        SDM_DIAG_LOG_EVENT(("SDM_MIRRORING_EVENT_FINISH_MIRRORING message received"));
                        SDM_FinishMirroring();
                        exit_task = true;
                        break;

                    case SDM_EVENT_MIRRORING_FINISHED:
                        SDM_MirroringFinishedHandler(messagePtr);
                        break;
}


/**
 * @brief Handler for the SDM_EVENT_MIRRORING_FINISHED message (aborts the software download)
 * @param[in] messagePtr Message pointer
 */
void SDM_MirroringFinishedHandler(const SDM_MESSAGE* messagePtr)
{
    SDM_DIAG_LOG_FN_ENTRY("SDM_MirroringFinishedHandler");

    switch (messagePtr->payload.mirroring.completionStatus)
    {
        case SDM_COMPLETION_STATUS_COMPLETE:
            SDM_SPC_WriteWithTimeStamp("[BGLOAD] Mirroring complete\n");
            break;

        case SDM_COMPLETION_STATUS_ABORTED:
            SDM_SPC_WriteWithTimeStamp("[BGLOAD] Mirroring aborted\n");
            break;

        case SDM_COMPLETION_STATUS_FAILED:
            SDM_SPC_WriteWithTimeStamp("[BGLOAD] Mirroring failed\n");
            break;

        default:
            SDM_SPC_WriteWithTimeStamp("[BGLOAD] Mirroring ended with unknown status\n");
            break;
    }

    SDM_DIAG_LOG_INFO(("notifying the client about mirroring status: %d", messagePtr->payload.mirroring.completionStatus));

    SDM_ClientMirroringNotify(messagePtr->payload.mirroring.completionStatus);

    SDM_DIAG_LOG_FN_EXIT(0U);
    return;
}

// ./build_mips/httpsend-0.0/src/httpsend.c

static int ReadData(void* buffer, int bufsize)
{
    DEBUG("currpos = (%d/%d)\r", (int)lseek(fd,0,SEEK_CUR),filelen);
    if (fileheader[0]) {
        int ret = snprintf(buffer, bufsize, "%s", fileheader);
        fileheader[0] = 0;
        return ret;
    } else {
        return read(fd, buffer, bufsize);
    }
}


={============================================================================
|kt_si_log_0001| SI-11300 Hardware - HDCP - HDCP error OSD is contiunally displayed on all outputs 

The requirements are specified in BSKYB-REQ-1865:

4.2	HDCP error detected
An HDMI sink began HDCP authentication but provided an invalid response. Invalid responses are defined in 4.2.1 and 4.2.2.
This condition shall not occur because the sink is not responding.
This condition is not synonymous with any HDCP state, but instead is triggered by a number of HDCP state transitions, see 4.2.1 and 4.2.2.
This condition shall persist until the user acknowledges by pressing BACKUP.

This is about HDCP_ERROR = 7; The issue is that when not-compatible TV is
connceted, there is OSD displayed for once but EPG keeps showing after user
acknowledged it by pressing a backup key.

void PREFS_TERMINAL_callHdmiStateListener(PREFS_API_TerminalHandle terminal_handle,
                                          PREFS_API_TERMINAL_HdmiState state,
                                          bool auto_reply)
{
    for (i=0U; i< PREFS_API_MAX_NUM_HDMI_STATE_LISTENER; i++)
    {
        /* In this case only the listener of the terminal_handle has to be called */
        if (auto_reply == true)
        {
        }
        else
        {
            if (f_PREFS_API_RegisterHdmiStateListeners[i].handle != PREFS_API_REGISTER_LISTENER_ILLEGAL_HANDLE)
            {
                DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_prefs_c2s_diag_segment_id, ("KT: 2: i=%d, state=%#x, lstate=%#x", i, state, f_PREFS_API_RegisterHdmiStateListeners[i].last_notified_hdmi_state));

                if ( (f_PREFS_API_RegisterHdmiStateListeners[i].listener != NULL) &&
                     (f_PREFS_API_RegisterHdmiStateListeners[i].last_notified_hdmi_state != state) )
                {
                    f_PREFS_API_RegisterHdmiStateListeners[i].last_notified_hdmi_state = state;

                    DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_prefs_c2s_diag_segment_id, ("KT: 3: i=%d, state=%#x, lstate=%#x", i, state, f_PREFS_API_RegisterHdmiStateListeners[i].last_notified_hdmi_state));
                    f_PREFS_API_RegisterHdmiStateListeners[i].listener(state, f_PREFS_API_RegisterHdmiStateListeners[i].user_tag);
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

WHY NOT maintaining last state? NO, state gets toggled between 7 and 5.

git diff BSKYB_HR019_Int/BSKYB_INTEGRATION_BLD_87.67.03_BSKYB_HR019_Int BSKYB_GM_Integration/BSKYB_INTEGRATION_BLD_41.88.00_BSKYB_GM_Integration -- DARWIN_PLATFORM/DARWIN_PREFS/src


={============================================================================
|kt_si_log_0001| SI-11299 Hardware - HDCP - HDCP error OSD displayed when connected to non-CAPABLE device

The requirements are specified in BSKYB-REQ-1865:

4.3	HDCP not available

An HDMI sink has been detected but HDCP has not been authenticated. This
includes incomplete (or not started) HDCP authentication and failed
authentication that has been acknowledged by the user (i.e. after the user has
    pressed BACKUP on the HDCP EPG).  All analogue video outputs shall
operated as normal.

A blank (black), but valid, video signal shall be driven on HDMI.

This condition can occur during HDCP states H1, H2/3, A0, A1, A2, A3, A6, A7, A8, A9.

This is somewhat historical, but I read it to be that, for a non-capable
device (this problem) no OSD should be displayed - a black screen will be
displayed on the HDMI output.

The point: So NO OSD for HDCP not available case. `since HR019 do not show the issue` 

mgrep.py "KEY_PRESS|Showing dialog|TUNING TO|CHANNEL CHANGED|MilestoneNotifier|_RUNNING_STATUS|PLAYER_PrefsHDMIStateListenerHandlerSessionAction|KT|PLAYER_Common_"

{
    BEM_OC_OUTPUT_CHANNEL_USE_UNDEF             = 0,
    BEM_OC_OUTPUT_CHANNEL_USE_SD                   ,     /*!< @brief SD video + analogue audio */
    BEM_OC_OUTPUT_CHANNEL_USE_HD                   ,     /*!< @brief HD video + digital audio */

    BEM_OC_OUTPUT_CHANNEL_USE_VIDEO_TRANSCODE      ,     /*!< @brief Video transcode */
    BEM_OC_OUTPUT_CHANNEL_USE_ANALOGUE_AUDIO       ,     /*!< @brief Analogue audio only */
    BEM_OC_OUTPUT_CHANNEL_USE_LASTVALUE

	PREFS_API_TERMINAL_HDMI_STATE_HDMI_NOT_AVAILABLE            =2U,
	/**<  The HDMI Output Port is Enabled. Waiting for an Active HDMI Sink Device to be attached and powered. */

	PREFS_API_TERMINAL_HDMI_STATE_HDCP_NOT_AVAILABLE            =5U,
	/**<  An Active HDMI Sink has been detected, but AV is not being transmitted.
          HDCP authentication has failed and been acknowledged by the user.
          HDCP authentication is not being retried.
          PREFS_API_TERMINAL_PROPID_UINT32_HDCP_NOT_AVAILABLE_TIMER indicates the time to remain in HDCP Not Available (Initial) state */

Backtrace stopped: frame did not save the PC


It was in "Help and Support" iapp session and was caused by SIGBUS which
likely means invalid access to mapped region. Re thread safetyness, will check
and get back to you. Does that mean LAE runs multiple threads to access GFX?

Found that not all GFX interfaces to an application provides thread safety;
some do but some don't. The `GFX_IMAGE_Resume` in question don't. As discussed
  Tim Trew, MW shall provide thread safety across all GFX interface for
  consistency. Therefore, move to MW GFX.

<1> resume
// CMS_PLATFORM_SERVICES/GFX/inc/gfx_image.h
extern SYSTEM_STATUS GFX_IMAGE_Resume (GFX_IMAGE_Image anImage);

// CMS_PLATFORM_SERVICES/GFX/src/image/gfx_image_library.c
SYSTEM_STATUS GFX_IMAGE_Resume (GFX_IMAGE_Image anImage) {
  return GFX_IMAGE_RunAutomaton (anImage, GFX_IMAGE_RequestResume, NULL, 0UL);
}

SYSTEM_STATUS GFX_IMAGE_RunAutomaton (GFX_IMAGE_Image anImage, GFX_IMAGE_Request aRequest, uint8_t *anAddress, uint32_t aLength) {
    case GFX_IMAGE_RequestResume :
      status = anImage->api->resumeDecomp (anImage);
}

// CMS_PLATFORM_SERVICES/GFX/src/image/jpeg_interface/gfx_image_jpeg_interface.c
static GFX_IMAGE_DecoderAPI   jpeg_interface_DecoderAPI = {
  GFX_IMAGE_API_ID_JPEG,            /* id */
  JPEG_HEADER_SIZE,                 /* signNbByte */
  JPEG_INTERFACE_IsOfType,          /* isOfType */

  JPEG_INTERFACE_DestroyDecomp,     /* destroyDecomp */
  JPEG_INTERFACE_ReadImageSize,     /* readImageSize */
  JPEG_INTERFACE_LaunchDecomp,      /* launchDecomp */
  JPEG_INTERFACE_ResumeDecomp,      /* resumeDecomp */

static SYSTEM_STATUS JPEG_INTERFACE_ResumeDecomp (GFX_IMAGE_Image anImage) {
      status = JPEG_INTERFACE_Configure (anImage);
}

// anImage have surface poiner
static SYSTEM_STATUS JPEG_INTERFACE_Configure (GFX_IMAGE_Image anImage) {
  /* Create bitmap */
  status = GFX_IMAGE_InitDecompressedImage (anImage, anImage->displayWidth, anImage->displayHeight, &anImage->decompressedImage);
}

SYSTEM_STATUS GFX_IMAGE_InitDecompressedImage (GFX_IMAGE_Image              anImage)
{
   status = GFX_SURFACE_CreateFromMemory (anImage->pixelFormat, aDisplayWidth, aDisplayHeight, &surface);
   { 
     surface->mappedAddress = MEMMAN_API_AllocStaticAlignP (s_gfx_cm.pool, surface->mappedSize, surface->blitterAlignment->baseAlignment);
   }
}


<2> destroy. LAE calls
SYSTEM_STATUS GFX_IMAGE_Destroy (GFX_IMAGE_Image anImage)
  status = anImage->api->destroyDecomp (anImage, GFX_IMAGE_ALL_IMAGES);
    static SYSTEM_STATUS JPEG_INTERFACE_DestroyDecomp (GFX_IMAGE_Image anImage, uint16_t anIndex) {

      JPEG_INTERFACE_FreeDecompRessources (GFX_IMAGE_Image anImage);

      // this can be called more than once
      (void) GFX_IMAGE_FreeDecompressedImage (anImage, &anImage->decompressedImage);
    }


<3> stop
SYSTEM_STATUS GFX_IMAGE_RunAutomaton (GFX_IMAGE_Image anImage, GFX_IMAGE_Request aRequest, uint8_t *anAddress, uint32_t aLength) {
    case GFX_IMAGE_RequestResume :
      status = anImage->api->stopDecomp (anImage);
}

static SYSTEM_STATUS JPEG_INTERFACE_StopDecomp (GFX_IMAGE_Image anImage) {
  GFX_IMAGE_PRINT_FN_ENTRY ("JPEG_INTERFACE_StopDecomp");
  return JPEG_INTERFACE_DestroyDecomp (anImage, GFX_IMAGE_ALL_IMAGES);
}

// old way
// kyoupark@st-castor-03:~/STB_SW$ git describe
// BSKYB_GM_Integration/BSKYB_INTEGRATION_BLD_41.73.00_BSKYB_GM_Integration

typedef struct
{
    bool                   response_received;
    SYSTEMUTIL_THR_Mutex_t mutex;
    SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_Cond_t cond;

} GUIDE_AsyncCallbackStruct;

static GUIDE_AsyncCallbackStruct f_planner_window_cond;

SYSTEM_STATUS GUIDE_API_ProgrammeInstance_GetBookingProperties()
{
  /* In order to make this interface reentrant create a new request with each querry of planner
     for the current programme instance. When this API is called simultaneously for an identical
     programme instance, each querry to planner shall work with the associated request and does
     not impact each other. */

  GuidePrepareForAsyncCallback(&f_planner_window_cond)
  { 
    SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MutexLock(&asyncCallbackStruct->mutex); 
    `asyncCallbackStruct->response_received = false;`
  }

  GUIDE_Int_PLANNER_API_Session_RetrieveProgInstBookingPropsInTimeWindow(l_planner_session,
      GuideProgrammeInstanceBookingPropsListener);

  GuideWaitForAsyncCallback(&f_planner_window_cond);
  // SYSTEM_STATUS GuideWaitForAsyncCallback(GUIDE_AsyncCallbackStruct *asyncCallbackStruct)
  // {
  //     /* Wait for the callback function to have been called */
  // 
  //     (void)SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_GetTime(&timeout_value);
  // 
  //     timeout_value.tv_sec += GUIDE_DEFAULT_RETRIEVAL_TIMEOUT;
  // 
  //     while ((asyncCallbackStruct->response_received == false) && (sys_status == SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK))
  //     {
  //         sys_status = SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_CondTimedWait(&asyncCallbackStruct->cond, &asyncCallbackStruct->mutex, &timeout_value);
  //         if (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK != sys_status)
  //         {
  //             DIAG_LOG_WARN(g_guide_diag_segment_id, ("SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_CondTimedWait() FAILED sys_status=%#x", sys_status));
  //             status = GUIDE_API_STATUS_FAILED;
  //         }
  //     }
  // 
  //     /* Unlock iterator_callback_mutex */
  //     if (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK != SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MutexUnlock(&asyncCallbackStruct->mutex))
  // }
}

static void GuideProgrammeInstanceBookingPropsListener(PLANNER_API_UserTag user_tag)
  GuideSignalCallbackReceived(&f_planner_window_cond);

/**
    A callback function calls this function in cases where asynchronous functions in the SIM say are
    needed to be made to look synchronous.

    See GuidePrepareForAsyncCallback for more details

    @param asyncCallbackStruct pointer to the async callback data structure
*/
void GuideSignalCallbackReceived(GUIDE_AsyncCallbackStruct *asyncCallbackStruct)
{
    /* Lock iterator_callback_mutex */
    if (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK != SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MutexLock(&asyncCallbackStruct->mutex))
    {
    }
    else
    {
        `asyncCallbackStruct->response_received = true;`

        /* Signal the condition variable */
        if (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK!=SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_CondSignal(&asyncCallbackStruct->cond))

        /* Unlock iterator_callback_mutex */
        if (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK != SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MutexUnlock(&asyncCallbackStruct->mutex))
    }
}


// ** NEW ** NOT reproducible
// kyoupark@st-castor-03:~/STB_SW_o$ git describe
// BSKYB_HR019_Int/BSKYB_INTEGRATION_BLD_87.52.00_BSKYB_HR019_Int
// DARWIN_PLATFORM/DARWIN_GUIDE/src/guide_api_programmeinstance.c

SYSTEMUTIL_THR_Mutex_t f_planner_window_mutex = SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_Cond_t f_planner_window_cond;

// callback from SIM
static void GuideProgrammeInstanceBookingPropsListener()
{
  GuideSignalCallbackReceived(&f_planner_window_mutex, &f_planner_window_cond)
  {
    /* Lock iterator_callback_mutex */
    if (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK != SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MutexLock(callback_mutex))
    {
      /* Signal the condition variable */
      if (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK!=SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_CondSignal(callback_cond))
      {
        DIAG_LOG_WARN(g_guide_diag_segment_id, ("Failed to signal iterator_callback_cond"));
      }

      /* Unlock iterator_callback_mutex */
      if (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK != SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MutexUnlock(callback_mutex))
      {
        DIAG_LOG_WARN(g_guide_diag_segment_id, ("Failed to unlock iterator_callback_mutex"));
      }
    }
  }
}


SYSTEM_STATUS GUIDE_API_ProgrammeInstance_GetBookingProperties()
{
  /* In order to make this interface reentrant create a new request with each querry of planner
     for the current programme instance. When this API is called simultaneously for an identical
     programme instance, each querry to planner shall work with the associated request and does
     not impact each other. */

  /* Get the booking status handle (asynchronous) */
  GuidePrepareForAsyncCallback(&f_planner_window_mutex);
  {
    (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK != SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MutexLock(callback_mutex));
  }
  
  if (PLANNER_API_STATUS_OK != GUIDE_Int_PLANNER_API_Session_RetrieveProgInstBookingPropsInTimeWindow(l_planner_session,
        l_start_time,
        l_duration,
        (PLANNER_API_UserTag)l_request_handle,
        GuideProgrammeInstanceBookingPropsListener,
        GuideProgrammeInstanceBookingPropsUpdateListener))

  (void)SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_GetTime(&timeout_value);
  timeout_value.tv_sec += GUIDE_DEFAULT_RETRIEVAL_TIMEOUT;

  /* This request handle will be of a valid value once the listener gets called, which means
     we have a returned planner handle no matter the returned status OK or failed. */
  while (l_request_handle != request_object_data->request.cached_window.proginst_list_request_handle)
  {
    if (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK != SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_CondTimedWait(&f_planner_window_cond, &f_planner_window_mutex, &timeout_value))
    {
      DIAG_LOG_WARN(g_guide_diag_segment_id, ("SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_CondTimedWait() FAILED"));
      l_status = GUIDE_API_STATUS_FAILED;
      break;
    }
  }

  system_status = SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MutexUnlock(&f_planner_window_mutex);
  DIAG_LOG_ASSERT_EQUAL(g_guide_diag_segment_id, SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK, system_status);
}

<Q>
If the cause is a race on predicate then shall see this "KT" log lines more
since it loops on this predicate. But not when reproduced.

SYSTEM_STATUS GuideWaitForAsyncCallback(GUIDE_AsyncCallbackStruct *asyncCallbackStruct)
{
    while ((asyncCallbackStruct->response_received == false) && (sys_status == SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK))
    {
        DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_guide_diag_segment_id, ("KT: SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_CondTimedWait() received=%#d", asyncCallbackStruct->response_received));

        sys_status = SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_CondTimedWait(&asyncCallbackStruct->cond, &asyncCallbackStruct->mutex, &timeout_value);
        if (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK != sys_status)
        {
            DIAG_LOG_WARN(g_guide_diag_segment_id, ("SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_CondTimedWait() FAILED sys_status=%#x", sys_status));
            status = GUIDE_API_STATUS_FAILED;
        }
    }

    /* Unlock iterator_callback_mutex */

    if (SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK != SYSTEMUTIL_THR_MutexUnlock(&asyncCallbackStruct->mutex))

    return status;
}

SYSTEM_STATUS PLAYER_API_AVControl_UpdateDisplay(PLAYER_API_AVControl_Handle avcontrol)
{
  // for graphic, still, and video
  if(!SYSTEM_STATUS_IS_OK(PLAYER_PRV_AVControl_UpdateSurface(PLAYER_API_AVControl_SourceType_Graphics,
          &l_avcontrol_data->g_surface, ~
          l_graphic_input_window,
          &l_update_graphic_visibility,
          l_sc_data)))
}

// l_av_surface is input
SYSTEM_STATUS PLAYER_PRV_AVControl_UpdateSurface(PLAYER_API_AVControl_SourceType    l_source,
                                                 PLAYER_AVCONTROL_SURFACE           *l_av_surface, ~
                                                 PLAYER_API_AVControl_Window        *graphic_input_window,
                                                 bool                               *update_visibility,
                                                 PLAYER_SERVICE_CONTEXT_DATA        *sc_data)
{
  if(!SYSTEM_STATUS_IS_OK(PLAYER_PRV_AVControl_UpdateWindows(l_source,
          l_player_surface,
          graphic_input_window,
          &l_av_surface->input_window,
          &l_av_surface->output_window,
          l_av_surface->reset_window))) ~
}

SYSTEM_STATUS PLAYER_PRV_AVControl_UpdateWindows(PLAYER_API_AVControl_SourceType l_source,
                                                 PLAYER_SURFACE *p_surface,
                                                 PLAYER_API_AVControl_Window *graphic_input_window,
                                                 PLAYER_API_AVControl_Window *input_window,
                                                 PLAYER_API_AVControl_Window *output_window,
                                                 bool reset_window)
{
    if(l_source == PLAYER_API_AVControl_SourceType_Video)
    {
        if(reset_window == true)
        {
            if(PLAYER_API_STATUS_OK != PLAYER_PRV_ResetVideoPlaneWindows(p_surface))
        }
    }
}

{

    if (p_surface_plane->plane_enable)
    {
        if (!SYSTEM_STATUS_IS_OK(BEM_OC_VideoComposition_ResetPlaneWindows(p_surface_plane->composition_handle,
                                                                           p_surface_plane->plane_handle)))

/*===========================================================================*/
/**  @brief Allows BEM clients to reset the plane windows. If the plane is a
  *  video plane BEM will then apply picture formatting to the viewport
  *  windows.
  *
  *
  *  @param[in] composition Identifies the Video Composition.
  *  @param[in] plane Identifies the Plane to reset.
  *
  *  @retval BEM_STATUS_OK if successful
  *  @retval BEM_STATUS_NOT_OK on error
  *
  *  @pre The plane must be enabled
  *
  *  @sa #BEM_OC_VideoComposition_AttachPlane
  *  @sa #BEM_OC_VideoComposition_EnablePlane
  *  @sa #BEM_OC_VideoComposition_SetPlaneWindows
  *
  */
/*===========================================================================*/
SYSTEM_STATUS BEM_OC_VideoComposition_ResetPlaneWindows(BEM_OC_OUTPUT_COMPOSITION_Handle composition,
                                                        BEM_OC_OUTPUT_PLANE_Handle plane)
{
    SYSTEM_STATUS status;

    DIAG_DECLARE_FUNCTION("BEM_OC_VideoComposition_ResetPlaneWindows");
    DIAG_LOG_FN_ENTRY(g_BEM_ServerDiagSegId);
    DIAG_LOG_PARAMS(g_BEM_ServerDiagSegId,("composition:%d plane:%d", composition, plane));

    status = BEM_Composition_ResetPlaneWindows(composition, plane);

    DIAG_LOG_FN_EXIT(g_BEM_ServerDiagSegId, status);
    return status;
}


/*===========================================================================*/
/**  @brief Allows BEM clients to reset the windows of a plane. This function
  *  only applies to video planes (#BEM_OC_SOURCE_TYPE_VIDEO).
  *
  *  @param[in]  composition        - The composition containing the plane
  *  @param[in]  plane              - The plane in question
  *  @return                        - SYSTEM_STATUS
  */
/*===========================================================================*/
SYSTEM_STATUS BEM_Composition_ResetPlaneWindows(
                                    BEM_OC_OUTPUT_COMPOSITION_Handle composition,
                                    BEM_OC_OUTPUT_PLANE_Handle plane)
{

// tune to HD after exiting iapp

// 6503/COMMON_MIDDLEWARE/HGH/src/server/pwm_init.c
static void PwmShutdownRestartImmediate(SYSTEMALARM_ALARM_HANDLE handle, uint32_t user_data_handle)
{
    handle = handle;
    user_data_handle = user_data_handle;
    
    DIAG_DECLARE_FUNCTION("PwmShutdownRestartImmediate");

    /* This is used in testing.
     * It allows CI to know the box was forced to shutdown (and is about to finish).
     * Simply output this exact diag to allow the tests to complete.
     **/
    DIAG_LOG_MIL(g_PWM_SERVER_PwmDiag, ("Forcing Restart"));

    PWM_CallPowerHelper(PWM_REQUEST_SHUTDOWN_RESTART);

    return;
}

// 6190/COMMON_MIDDLEWARE/HGH/src/server/pwm_init.c
static void PwmShutdownRestartImmediate(SYSTEMALARM_ALARM_HANDLE handle, uint32_t user_data_handle)
{
    handle = handle;
    user_data_handle = user_data_handle;
    
    DIAG_DECLARE_FUNCTION("PwmShutdownRestartImmediate");

    /* This is used in testing.
     * It allows CI to know the box was forced to shutdown (and is about to finish).
     * Simply output this exact diag to allow the tests to complete.
     **/
    DIAG_LOG_MIL(g_PWM_SERVER_PwmDiag, ("SI_BUILD_TEST: Forcing Restart"));

    /* This is blocking call. Timeout = 10 secs */
    if(g_disable_hdd_write_cache_on_shutdown_timer_expiry)
    {
        PWM_UTIL_SetWC(HDD_WC_DISABLE);
        // if (!wcache)
        // { 
        //     /* 10 secs sleep required before SoC reset to flush the data */
        //     sleep(DISK_FLUSH_DELAY);
        // }
    }
    PWM_CallPowerHelper(PWM_REQUEST_SHUTDOWN_RESTART);

    return;
}

// CMS_PLATFORM_SERVICES/AEM/src/aem_internal_xsi.c
SYSTEM_STATUS AEM_Application_Terminate(Application *app)
{
    SYSTEM_STATUS status = AEM_API_STATUS_ERROR;

    AEM_DIAG_LOG_FN_ENTRY("AEM_Application_Terminate");

    if (g_aem_use_mhc_not_otv)
    {
        if(app->applicationInfo.type != AEM_API_ApplicationType_Resident)
        {
            DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_aem_segment_id, ("KT: AEM_AppSignalingInfo_Terminate"));

            if (!SYSTEM_STATUS_IS_OK(AEM_AppSignallingInfo_Terminate(app)))
        }

        /* If the app->engine != NULL, then we must call terminate_CB of App engine */
        if ((app->engine == NULL) &&
                ((app->applicationInfo.state == AEM_API_ApplicationStateLoading) ||
                        (app->applicationInfo.state == AEM_API_ApplicationStatePending)))
        {

            DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_aem_segment_id, ("KT: AEM_FireAppEvent"));

            AEM_StateAppEvent appEvent = {AEM_FireAppEvent, AEM_API_ApplicationEventTerminated, app->applicationInfo.applicationHandle,
                    {app->applicationInfo.identifier.provider_id, app->applicationInfo.identifier.application_id}};
            (void)AEM_RunAsync(&appEvent, sizeof(AEM_StateAppEvent));

            status = AEM_API_STATUS_OK;
        }
        else
        {
            DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_aem_segment_id, ("KT: AEM_Terminate: not optv"));
            status = AEM_TerminateApp(app);
        }
    }
    else
    {
        DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_aem_segment_id, ("2 Calling AEM_TerminateApp"));
        DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_aem_segment_id, ("KT: AEM_Terminate"));
        status = AEM_TerminateApp(app);

    }
  return(status);
}

// CMS_PLATFORM_SERVICES/AEM/src/aem_sys.c

/** @brief the internals of the terminate function */
SYSTEM_STATUS AEM_TerminateApp(Application *app)
{
    SYSTEM_STATUS status = AEM_API_STATUS_ERROR;

    DIAG_DECLARE_FUNCTION ("AEM_TerminateApp");
    DIAG_LOG_FN_ENTRY (g_aem_segment_id);

    if(app->engine == NULL)
    {
        DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_aem_segment_id, ("Application not started yet"));
    }
    else if(app->engine->application_engine_info.terminate_fn == NULL)
    {
        DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_aem_segment_id, ("engine terminate_fn = NULL"));
        status = AEM_API_STATUS_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED;
    }
    else
    {
        /* In case of error state, AEM will not pass by state stopping, because the engine can never */
        app->applicationInfo.state = app->applicationInfo.state == AEM_API_ApplicationStateError ? AEM_API_ApplicationStateStopped :
                AEM_API_ApplicationStateStopping ;

        DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_aem_segment_id, (" app->applicationInfo.state %d",app->applicationInfo.state))

        (void)app->engine->application_engine_info.terminate_fn(app->applicationInfo.applicationHandle);

        (void)AEM_ListRemoveKeySubscriptionForApp(app->applicationInfo.applicationHandle);
        status = AEM_API_STATUS_OK;
    }

    DIAG_LOG_FN_EXIT (g_aem_segment_id, status);
    return status;
}


// The aim is to see if LAE DO NOT notify AEM even when EPG requested to
// terminate iapp. To do this and minimize logging, add only two prints to
// AEM_ApplicationStateEventListener which is a callback from LAE to AEM to
// notify iapp state changes such as Running, Stopping, or Terminated. See
// *iapp-event*

={============================================================================
|kt_si_log_0001| SI-11140 R15 - Stress - R019.087.11.00 - Phase 1 - OD.14(R15_89x) - PDL Browse (Phase 1) (11.14) failure 

`APP_GFX_IMAGE` OOM. moved to EPG. 

A: 176904 bytes is the memory required for a single cover art image (182x243 *
    4 bytes per pixel). R15 introduces wall of cover art in Cinema and Store,
  which displays up to 15 cover art images.

The EPG should be copying each decoded image to its own GFX surface and then
immediately freeing it, but there are some threading issues with the way it
does this in some places.

// DARWIN_PLATFORM/DARWIN_ATG/src/oigc/atg_api_oigc.c

                /* Wait for the catalogue to be aquired.*/
                WELL_KNOWN_CLASSIF_STATUS_LOCK();

                (void)SYSTEMUTIL_SYNC_GetTime(&cond_var_timeout);
                cond_var_timeout.tv_sec += ATG_WELL_KNOWN_CLASSIF_REQUEST_TIMEOUT();
                status = SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK;
                while((ATG_GET_WELL_KNOWN_CLASSIF() != ATG_WELL_KNOWN_CLASSIFICATION_STATUS_RETRIEVED) &&
                      (ATG_GET_WELL_KNOWN_CLASSIF() != ATG_WELL_KNOWN_CLASSIFICATION_STATUS_TIMEOUT) &&
                      (status == SYSTEMUTIL_STATUS_OK))
                {
                    ATG_DIAG_LOG_INFO(("Waiting for status to be retrieved or timeout."));
                    status = WELL_KNOWN_CLASSIF_STATUS_WAIT_CHANGE(&cond_var_timeout);
                }

// value? where doet it come from?
#define ATG_WELL_KNOWN_CLASSIF_REQUEST_TIMEOUT()    (ATG_API_Ctxt.well_known_classif_timeout)   
/* This value is used to timeout a synchronous request to get catalogue ID and Well Known Classification.*/

DARWIN_PLATFORM/DARWIN_ATG/src/oigc/atg_api_oigc.c

                 ATG_DIAG_LOG_INFO(("request failed - retry"));

                 /* Retry the request using random alarm between ATG_MIN_RETRY_TIME and ATG_GET_BACKOFF_TIMEOUT_1 */
                 randomNumber = ((uint32_t)rand() % ((ATG_GET_BACKOFF_TIMEOUT_1() - ATG_MIN_RETRY_TIME) + 1U))+ ATG_MIN_RETRY_TIME;

                 ATG_DIAG_LOG_INFO(("Cat id random retry alarm : %d", randomNumber));

                 /* Arm timer to ask randomly the OIGC server status */
                 (void)ATG_API_SetAlarm(true, randomNumber, ATG_GET_CURRENT_SESSION() );

 * @param[in]   service_key     of service record required.
 *
 * @retval      pointer         to #SIM_PI_XSI_SSL_DATA service record.
 */
static XSI_SERVICE *SIM_pi_xsi_ssl_GetSslDataRec(uint16_t service_key)
{
    SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_Node_t ssl_node;
    XSI_SERVICE *xsi_service = NULL;

    SIM_TB_LOG_FN_ENTRY("SIM_pi_xsi_ssl_GetSslDataRec");

    ssl_node = SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_Lookup(f_sim_ssl_service_lookup_htable, &service_key);
    if (NULL != ssl_node)
    {
        xsi_service = SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_NodeGet(ssl_node);
    }

    SIM_TB_LOG_FN_EXITP(xsi_service);
    return xsi_service;
}

                /* create service key hash table to provide service key lookup into f_sim_ssl_data service record array */
                status = SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_Create(
                    &f_sim_ssl_service_lookup_htable,
                    g_sim_plugin_util_context,
                    g_sim_pi_xsi_config.max_services,

                    // provide compare function
                    `SIM_pi_xsi_ssl_ServiceKeyCompareFn`,
                    SIM_pi_xsi_ssl_ServiceKeyHashFn
                );

// save up in the hash table
SYSTEM_STATUS SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_Insert(SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_Table_t hash,
                                                   SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_Node_t node, const void *key)

SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_Node_t ssl_node;
ssl_node = SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_Lookup(f_sim_ssl_service_lookup_htable, p_hash_key);

SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_Create(SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_Table_t * _hash)
{
    /* Allocate a hash table control structure. */
    SYSTEMUTIL_CTX_MALLOC(status, hash, SYSTEMUTIL_HASH_Table_t, ctx, sizeof *hash);
}


#4  0x00cc761c in SIM_PI_XSI_SSL_ScheduleAcquired (p_section=0x22d3c44 "\f, odsa_requested_section=false, p_skevt_sections_processing_data=0x1a9dd38, p_section_is_update=0x1a9dd10,
    p_subtable_complete=0x0) at src/sim_pi_xsi_ssl.c:4750

/** @link SIM_PI_XSI_SSL_ScheduleAcquired() SIM_PI_XSI_SSL_ScheduleAcquired() @endlink */
bool SIM_PI_XSI_SSL_ScheduleAcquired(const uint8_t                             *p_section,
                                     bool                                       odsa_requested_section,
                                     SIM_PI_XSI_SKEVT_SECTIONS_PROCESSING_DATA *p_skevt_sections_processing_data,
                                     bool                                      *p_section_is_update,
                                     bool                                      *p_subtable_complete)
{
  /* Read the section to find out where in the SSL it relates. */
  SIM_PSI_ParsePrivateSectionHeader(p_section, &bits_processed, &skevt_header);

  p_service = SIM_pi_xsi_ssl_GetSslDataRec(skevt_header.table_id_extention);
}

 * @brief Set up section buffers and start processing sections from the given files.
 *

static SIM_STATUS SIM_pi_xsi_skevt_sections_ProcessMASectionsFromFile(int skevt_m_fd,
                                                                      int skevt_a_fd,
                                                                      bool fill_ppv_only)
{
  // read from fd

  if (true == SIM_PI_XSI_SSL_ScheduleAcquired(f_sim_pi_xsi_skevt_sections_skevt_m))
    ;
}

<test-harness>
Test harness:
@Override public void run()
{
  try
  {
    int streamPosition = playerSession.getStreamPosition();
    if (startTime == 0)
    {
      startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
      startPosition = streamPosition;
    }

    int pos = streamPosition - startPosition;
    long time = System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime;
    System.out.println("JT: PlaybackFromEnd.run: streamPosition=" + streamPosition + " pos=" + pos + " time=" + time + " delta=" + (pos - time));
  }
}

|kt_si_log_0001| SI-11077

[FT] Intermittently On Demand DPL assets are not fully downloaded.

R017.085.63.00

that the recording stops at what would be the last ad break in the broadcast
stream. i.e., when the Riveria screen comes up, that is when the End of
Recording message appears.


Hes reported the following 3 variants of the issue:
 
(when attempt to playback)

1. Episode shows as DOWNLOADED (i.e. all content should be present on the
    box), but stops at location of last advert break with End of Recording
banner.

1.	Items showing as AVAILABLE in the Planner (i.e. still downloading, but
there should be enough buffered to start and maintain playback) stop at
the location of the last advert break with the Your Programme is Downloading
banner when you attempt to play them back.

2.	Episode shows as AVAILABLE (i.e. enough content should be buffered to start
    and maintain playback), but stops at location of last advert break with
End of Recording banner.

2.	Items showing as DOWNLOADED in the Planner stop at the location of the last
advert break with the End of Recording banner when you attempt to play them
back.

3.	Episode shows as PART REC, with the reason being Remote Network Problem.

3.	Items showing as PART REC in the Planner show Remote Network Problem as
the reason for the partial recording.

<7> from D12
| R017.085.63.02U | 2017-06-17 21:38:17 | darwin_783e533494fc_dc35d66b30c9d2432b51a3adba7833b0.tgz |             |

When a Box Set is opened, the EPG make about three HTTP requests to the CMDC server.

Each of those connections has a 6s timeout so it is possible that that EPG may be unresponsive for 18s if network conditions are not favourable. 

If any of the connections does fail, I would expect to see an error dialog with ECTMO in the top corner.

That doesn't seem to be the case in your log as all three requests where responded to in sub second times.

THIRD_PARTY_LIBRARIES/BSKYB_JTH/build/applications/Picasso/picasso/Picasso/src/java/picasso/tvviewingmgr/banner/BannerController.java
	private boolean filterAndConsumeAction(IActionCodes actionCode)
	{
		boolean consume = false;

		if (viewingManuallyAddedService)
		{
			switch (actionCode)
			{
				case BOOK_RECORDING:
					consume = true;
					// This is also called from FSC doAction, in which case show Banner
					if (!isVisible())
					{
						show(USER_INTERACTION);
					}
					else
					{
						addVisibilityReason(FORCE_HIDE);
						bookingAgentListener.showDialog(RECORD_PLAYBACK_NOT_AVAILABLE_ID);
					}
					break;
			}
		}
		return consume;
	}

|kt_si_log_0001| SI-10968 R13 - Black screen displayed for approx 4 secs after exiting some Interactive apps

When exercise this scenario on video channel, this shows:

exit -> background still image from EPG (LAE set output control) -> blue on whole screen (LAE) -> black and banner (LAE) -> blue and banner (EPG) -> video (player)

The problem here is that output control during transition seems not well
defined and so see bumpy output to a user. EPG or EPG and LAE together has to
manage this as far as I see. Please note that "background still image" is
shown on audio channel as well and see video-case.nds for the summarized
log.  

black background on audio channel

exit -> background still image from EPG (LAE set output control) -> blue on whole screen (LAE) -> black and banner (LAE) -> blue and banner (EPG)

For non-radio channel:

<reported-in-jira>
Yard Link: http://theyard.uk.nds.com/si_logs/translation/darwin_0019fb5b8268_32ac5596cac049f86d47ba413547d1fe

ISSUE: a blue screen is displayed for a second, followed by a black screen for approximately 4 seconds before normal audio and video resume. 

note: blue -> black -> blue -> video

note: JIRA format

Here is more detailed analysis and used the same reported by Elizabeth for to
have accurate timing details. 

This shows the biggest delay is the time up to terminated event of iapp. I
believe that it is up to LAE/iapp/AEM. 

So in respect of "perforamce", what are we attempting to fix here? Then, it would be
good to know where we should focus on.

// ={============================================================================
// |kt_si_log_0001| SI-10966 System takes longer to respond on entering Pin on Pin prompt while tuned to encrypted channel after removing and reinserting Viewing card 
// 
// note: moved to EPG.
// 
// Hi Kyoungtaek Park, when Picasso is currently notified of a change (card in/out) we recheck the subscribed services.
// The way we currently do this is to make a series of calls to ca for each slot on the card.
// Each individual call takes a reasonably small amount of time, however there are 250 slots and this blows the 
// time taken way up. 
// 
// https://www.stb.bskyb.com/jira/browse/SI-10966
// 
// http://theyard.uk.nds.com/alog.php?log=/home/si_logs/translation/darwin_0019fb70e9f8_7e4d7dc0a549308c41674224535c31d1
//

={============================================================================
|kt_si_log_0001| SI-10927 Macroblocking and Audio loss after trick play on PDL asset

<sum>
note: driver issue
https://www.stb.bskyb.com/jira/browse/DRI-2064
https://www.stb.bskyb.com/jira/browse/DRI-2064?focusedCommentId=942851&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-942851
It is the additional DEMUX_EVENT_CHUNK_COMPLETED | DEMUX_EVENT_CHUNK_LIST_COMPLETED events causing the ChunkInput(CI) shared buffer corruption and PTS discontinuity.

From http://theyard.uk.nds.com/si_logs/translation/darwin_0019fb5b82bb_a24fbee83f5749c7a6ee0de003050206

// from pushp
CMS_MEDIA_SERVICES/MSM/src/mediastreamer/src/cdi_server.c
CMS_MEDIA_SERVICES/MSM/src/mediastreamer/src/buffer_pump.cp
CMS_MEDIA_SERVICES/MSM/src/mediastreamer/src/display_chunk.cpp


// on monitor
// ={============================================================================
// |kt_si_log_0001| SI-10933 R12H - HD PVR (Picasso) 00.04 - Pretesting (Step) failure - Unresponsive when attempting to play back OnDemand Asset
// 
// 
// Hi all,
// 
// Two findings to note for further investigation:
// 
// 1.	For failed cases, PDL has exception which is HTTP_404_NOT_FOUND but working case is not. But both dont have some SAs in the playlist.
// 2.	For failed cases, it looks that there seems little input chunks, reaches EOF, and is like doing TM on no input stream. Quite mangled MS since then.
// 
// Does is suggest that input/range calculation in MS is suspicious when SAs is missing in DPL download and playback?
// 
// Many thanks

={============================================================================
|kt_si_log_0001| SI-11050 SI-10421: R10 - DPL - When the trickmode is suppressed for SA, and the PA before it is FFWD x30, then the SA plays normally but it is not reported on ADMRS Logs

egrep -an "KEY_PRESS|TUNING TO|CHANNEL CHANGED|ScreenSeen|Showing dialog|VIDEO IS|TUNER_LOCKED|FRAME_PRESENTED|RUNNING_STATUS|MOVING TO|DownloadQueueMonitor|CTM_SVR|\-AMS"
egrep -an "KEY_PRESS|DownloadQueueMonitor|UploadData|raiseSpeedNotification|MSM_SP_SetSpeed|DplPlayIsTrickModeRestriction|DplPlay"
egrep -an "KEY_PRESS|DownloadQueueMonitor|CTM_SVR|UploadData|raiseSpeedNotification|MSM_SP_SetSpeed|DplPlayIsTrickModeRestriction|DplPlay|Given primary"
egrep -an "KEY_PRESS|UploadData|raiseSpeedNotification|MSM_SP_SetSpeed|DplPlayIsTrickModeRestriction|DplPlay|Given primary|UAM|GenerateWorklistForPlaylist"

egrep -an "KEY_PRESS|DownloadQueueMonitor|UploadData|raiseSpeedNotification|MSM_SP_SetSpeed|DplPlayIsTrickModeRestriction|DplPlay"

egrep -an "KEY_PRESS|raiseSpeedNotification|MSM_SP_SetSpeed|send DPLTI|UploadData|DplPlayIsTrickModeRestriction"


<issue>
two condition: SA2 epired and TM x30 speed.

In the following playlist
1   2   3     4   5   6   7   8
SA1 PA1 [SA2] SA3 PA2 SA4 PA3 SA5

  All SAs have 30 seconds long.

  Trick Mode suppression is on (Trick play on SAs are prohobitid so only 1x
  playback is possible)

  SA2 expired (so not played)

  Trick play at 30x performed on PA1 (the problem does not happen when 2x, 6x
  or 12x used)

  When playback reaches to SA3, it starts playing back at 1x as expected but
  no ADMRS log sent out for SA3.

  (means that "playlistid" is 1 which is the last, SA1, it's 4 for okay case
   when SA2 is not expired. both SA3 and SA4 are reported when SA2 is not
   expired.)

In the above sequence if SA2 is not expiring and PA1 is FFWD x30 then both SA2
& SA3 plays normally and both are reported on ADMRS logs.

I hope this clarifies the scenario.

Ulas Demirdag added a comment - 06/Feb/17 3:50 PM
Kyoungtaek Park, I believe this is correct. The problem only happens with the
SA which comes just after an expired asset.

Kyoungtaek Park added a comment - 07/Feb/17 3:06 PM
What I want to know if a expired SA is a root cause rather than TM speed and
I'm suspecting that as well.

kyoupark Kyoungtaek Park added a comment - 16/Feb/17 2:26 PM - edited
Sandhya Kumar, from following quote, please run two scenarios, ok case and not
ok case, by having SA2 expired and SA2 not expired so that we can compare two
to narrow down the issue.

Sandhya Kumar added a comment - 28/Feb/17 2:25 PM
Hi Kyoungtaek Park
Yes, the ADMRS logs `only the SAs.` it logs the `last played SA.` For both cases,
the Asset was playedback to SA3 and ends there. So in OK case, the last SA,
SA3, was logged but for NOT OK case, the last SA, SA1, was logged.


Q: Moved to R14 and are there plans to enable suppression of SAs in R14?

		If positive speed , the 'to' is the asset after the current asset.*/

			next_asset_node = assetsList_getNextAsset(pPle->playlist, p_from_entry_id_node,&next_asset);

			/* notify about subst switching */
			DIAG_LOG_INFO (VRM_diag_segment_id, ("send VRM_PLE_EVENT_SUBST_SWITCHED to anchor (forward play). subst_handle_out = 0x%x, subst_handle_in = 0x%x",
				p_from_entry_id_asset->subst_handle, next_asset->subst_handle));

			DIAG_LOG_INFO (VRM_diag_segment_id, ("send VRM_PLE_EVENT_SUBST_SWITCHED to anchor (reverse play). subst_handle_out = 0x%x, subst_handle_in = 0x%x",

5793305:NDS: ^[2017:01:08 15:50:34]0946951990.620509 !INFO   -VRM_SERVER                < p:0x000001d6 P:MW t:0x01e17520 T:VRM_SRV M:rb_play.c F:RB_PLAY_ReceiveMessage L:3774 > got RB_PLAY_MSG_TYPE_ALARM_TRIGGERED, rb_play_handle:0x18a1

5793308:NDS: ^[2017:01:08 15:50:34]0946951990.620949 !WARN   -MSM_MS                    < p:0x000001d6 P:MW t:0x01a41520 T:EVENT_MGR_THREAD M:splicer.cpp F:(GetSpliceDataByFromEntryIdAndSpeed) L:655 > <  >" 
"Splice point not found by from playlist entry 0 with concern to current speed -12000

However, as far as I see, the first is while TM and the others is when back to
live where `RB-PLAY` is stopped but not freed and destroyed. Hence no more
jobs which is the same as reported in the first place. So MW seems to have a
problem of handling a play list or get pos when reaches to the end of
`RB-PLAY` or when VRM believes `RB-PLAY` is running when MC actually is
stopped.

Rayees Khan, can you have a look and confirm if this is the same as the fix you mentioned?

|kt_si_log_0001| D12: Release 12 - 84.48 (23/09/16)

/**
 * @brief Write the programme instance object to the database.
 *
 * @param[in]      p_prog_inst_object              The programme instance to write to the database.
 * @param[in]      p_service_object                The DBC service object of the service showing the event.
 * @param[out]     p_db_write_occurred             Set to true if the programme instance was written to the database.
 * @param[in,out]  p_sim_pi_xsi_pf_user_data       SIM PI XSI user data.
 *
 * @retval #SIM_STATUS_OK      If successful.
 * @retval #SIM_STATUS_FAILED  Otherwise.
 */
static SIM_STATUS SIM_pi_xsi_pf_WritePIToDB(SIM_DBC_PROG_INST_OBJECT           *p_prog_inst_object,
                                            const SIM_DBC_SERVICE_OBJECT       *p_service_object,
                                            bool                               *p_db_write_occurred,
                                            SIM_PI_XSI_PF_PROCESSING_USER_DATA *p_sim_pi_xsi_pf_user_data)
{
  if (SIM_FLAG_ISSET(p_sim_pi_xsi_pf_user_data->p_mc_context->flags, SIM_PI_MC_CONTEXT_UNALIGNED_SCHEDULE))
  {
    /* PIs are not usually updated from the EIT-PF if the schedule is unaligned.
       The exception is when we want to update the synopsis information only. For
       example, when a secondary free-to-air network exists its EIT-PF synopsis
       may be different and more accurate than the home network's synopsis information. */
    status = SIM_pi_xsi_pf_UpdateUnalignedPI(p_prog_inst_object,
        p_sim_pi_xsi_pf_user_data->present,
        p_service_object->service_object_id,
        p_db_write_occurred);
    if (SIM_STATUS_OK != status)
    {
      SIM_TB_LOG_ERROR(("SIM_pi_xsi_pf_UpdateUnalignedPI()="SIM_STATUS_STRING_NO_PREFIX" FAILED"));
    }
  }
  else
  {
    if (SIM_STATUS_OK != SIM_DBC_MERGED_QUERY_GetMergeProfileFromSvcType(p_service_object->service_type,
          &p_merge_profile))
    {
      SIM_TB_LOG_ERROR(("Could not find a merge profile for the service, default primary source is SIM_DB"));
    }
    else
    {
      primary_source = p_merge_profile->primary_source;
    }
  }
}

!ERROR  -PLANNER_ITERATOR		< p:0x0000020e P:APP t:0x2bfeb520 T:no name M:planner_iterator.c F:PLANNER_StandardIteratorImpl_GetNextIndex L:1322 > Failed to refresh iterator 
!ERROR  -J_PLANNER    		< p:0x0000020e P:APP t:0x2bfeb520 T:no name M:modules/jpa-impl/src/c/src/natPlannerIteratorImp 
  F:Java_com_nds_fusion_plannerimpl_PlannerIteratorImpl_natPlannerIt L:77 > PLANNER_API_Iterator_GetNextIndex failed: 0x6422001

JNIEXPORT jint JNICALL Java_com_nds_fusion_plannerimpl_PlannerIteratorImpl_natPlannerIteratorNextIndex
  (JNIEnv *env, jclass jClass, jint param1)
{
    uint32_t jReturnVal = 0;

    PLANNER_API_Iterator_Handle jNativeHandle = (PLANNER_API_Iterator_Handle)param1;
    SYSTEM_STATUS status                      = PLANNER_API_STATUS_NOT_OK;

    JPA_DIAG_DECLARE_FUNCTION;
    DIAG_LOG_FN_ENTRY(g_planner_adaptor_api_diag_segment_id);

    status = PLANNER_API_Iterator_GetNextIndex(jNativeHandle, (int32_t*)&jReturnVal);
    if (!SYSTEM_STATUS_IS_OK(status))
    {
        DIAG_LOG_ERROR(g_planner_adaptor_api_diag_segment_id, ("PLANNER_API_Iterator_GetNextIndex failed: 0x%x", status));
    }

    (void)PLANNER_JAVA_ParseReturn(env, status);

    DIAG_LOG_FN_EXIT(g_planner_adaptor_api_diag_segment_id, status);
    return (jint)jReturnVal;
}


#ifdef PLANNER_ITERATORS_SUPPORTED
/**
 * @brief Standard iterator get `next index` implementation
 *
 * @param[in] iterator Iterator structure
 * @param[out] param_index The next object index to the iterator
 * @retval #PLANNER_API_STATUS_OK on success
 * @retval #PLANNER_API_STATUS_NOT_OK on failure
 */
static SYSTEM_STATUS PLANNER_StandardIteratorImpl_GetNextIndex(`PLANNER_ITERATOR_T` *iterator, int32_t *param_index)
{
    /* Refresh the iterator if there has been a change to the view */
    if (PLANNER_API_STATUS_OK != PLANNER_StandardIterator_RefreshIfNecessary(iterator->handle, false))
    {
        DIAG_LOG_ERROR( g_planner_iterator_diag_segment_id, ("Failed to refresh iterator"));
    }

    DIAG_LOG_FN_EXIT( g_planner_iterator_diag_segment_id, l_status);
    return l_status;
}

|kt_si_log_0001| SI-10782 SI-10746 HTTP_POOL OOM CURL

https://www.stb.bskyb.com/jira/browse/SI-10782
Updated to make clear about leaks patterns found.

2. From both set, leaks around HTTP_SAC_Create_SAC_Handle
Fixed by SI-10737.

1. From D.03, leaks around CTM_FTM_SetHTTPOptions
Not fixed by SI-10737 and have a fix for that.

3. From D.27, leaks around Curl_http_readwrite_headers
Under investigation with MW team.

// transfer.c

struct Cookie {
  struct Cookie *next; /* next in the chain */
  char *name;        /* <this> = value */
  char *value;       /* name = <this> */
  char *path;         /* path = <this> */
  char *domain;      /* domain = <this> */
  ...
};

struct CookieInfo {
  /* linked list of cookies we know of */
  struct Cookie *cookies;

  char *filename;  /* file we read from/write to */
  bool running;    /* state info, for cookie adding information */
  long numcookies; /* number of cookies in the "jar" */
  bool newsession; /* new session, discard session cookies on load */
};
